title: How to get the serialized version of the session cookie in 0.10?
raw_output: {'files_to_modify': ['flask/sessions.py', 'flask/globals.py', 'flask/app.py', 'flask/__init__.py', 'flask/json.py'], 'reasoning': '1. flask/sessions.py – Implements SecureCookieSession and SecureCookieSessionInterface; add a serialize method or API here to serialize session objects for the user. 2. flask/globals.py – global session proxy; modify if a new serialization method needs to be exposed on the session global. 3. flask/app.py – wires up session handling, public interface, and interacts with the session interface; ensure serialization API is exposed correctly. 4. flask/__init__.py – maintains API imports and exports for users. 5. flask/json.py – contains shared serialization logic, which may need changes if API is changed or extended.'}
